parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: earliest-publish-year
parameters.description: The books must have been published after this year.

parameters.name: latest-publish-year
parameters.description: The books must have been published before this year.

parameters.name: min-rating
parameters.description: The minimum rating the book must have gotten in the interval [0,1].

parameters.name: max-rating
parameters.description: The maximum rating the book must have gotten in the interval [0,1].

parameters.name: genres
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of genres. Only books from any of the given genres will be returned.

parameters.name: authors
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of author ids or names. Only books from any of the given authors will be returned. You can retrieve author ids from the search authors endpoint. Pass author names is slower and if two authors have the same name you can't disambiguate.

parameters.name: isbn
parameters.description: Only the book matching the ISBN-13 will be returned

parameters.name: oclc
parameters.description: Only the book matching the OCLC will be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sorting criteria (publish-date or rating).

parameters.name: sort-direction
parameters.description: Whether to sort ascending or descending (ASC or DESC).

parameters.name: group-results
parameters.description: Whether to group similar editions of the same book.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of books to skip in range [0,1000]

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of books to return in range [1,100]

get.description: Search and filter books based on matching a query, the ISBN, rating, and more fields. The query is semantically parsed using our own large ontology. That means you can search paranormal books and the ontology knows that Aliens, Werewolves, Ghosts, and Shapeshifters fall into that category.

get.description: Find books that are similar to the given book. This is useful for recommending books to users based on their reading history or preferences. The response will contain a list of similar books with their title, id, and cover image.

news.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed new details about the upcoming Cybertruck electric pickup truck. According to Musk, its initial production will begin with a four-motor variant.
news.text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed new details about the upcoming Cybertruck electric pickup truck, the mass production of which was delayed until 2023 because of the lack of components and a lot of complex technologies that need to be scaled up. According to Musk, the initial production of the electric pickup truck will begin with a four-motor variant with “independent, ultra fast response torque control of each wheel,” the tweet reads. In response, Twitter users asked if the Cybertruck could turn like a tank. Musk said that thanks to both the rear and front wheel steer, the electric truck will not only be able to turn like a tank, but also drive diagonally like a crab. According to Electrek, this change could be Tesla's reaction to what its competitors do. Since the introduction of Tesla’s novelty, the market for electric pickup trucks has significantly evolved. Currently, one electric pickup on the market can turn like a tank – the Rivian R1T, while GMC's Hummer EV can drive diagonally. Following the announcement of Tesla Cybertruck in 2019, the company announced three configurations of the pickup truck: the entry-level model with one motor, the one with two motors, and the one with three. Rumor has it that the company intends to abandon the single-motor version altogether. In this case, Tesla Cybertruck will be sold with two, three, and four motors. Musk has promised to provide an update on the pickup's roadmap on the next earnings call. The production of Tesla Cybertruck is expected to begin at the end of 2022, and its mass production is slated to start in 2023.
news.title: Tesla to Release a Four-Motor Version of Cybertruck

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to match in the news content. By default all query terms are expected, you can use an uppercase OR to search for any terms, e.g. tesla OR ford

parameters.name: source-countries
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ISO 3166 country codes from which the news should originate.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The ISO 6391 language code of the news.

parameters.name: min-sentiment
parameters.description: The minimal sentiment of the news in range [-1,1].

parameters.name: max-sentiment
parameters.description: The maximal sentiment of the news in range [-1,1].

parameters.name: earliest-publish-date
parameters.description: The news must have been published after this date.

parameters.name: latest-publish-date
parameters.description: The news must have been published before this date.

parameters.name: news-sources
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of news sources from which the news should originate.

parameters.name: authors
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of author names. Only news from any of the given authors will be returned.

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Filter news by entities (ORG, PER, or LOC).

parameters.name: location-filter
parameters.description: Filter news by radius around a certain location. Format is "latitude,longitude,radius in kilometers"

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sorting criteria (publish-time or sentiment).

parameters.name: sort-direction
parameters.description: Whether to sort ascending or descending (ASC or DESC).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of news to skip in range [0,10000]

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of news to return in range [1,100]

get.description: Search and filter news by text, date, location, language, and more. The API returns a list of news articles matching the given criteria. You can set as many filtering parameters as you like, but you have to set at least one, e.g. text or language.

According to Musk, the initial production of the electric pickup truck will begin with a four-motor variant with “independent, ultra fast response torque control of each wheel,” the tweet reads. In response, Twitter users asked if the Cybertruck could turn like a tank. Musk said that thanks to both the rear and front wheel steer, the electric truck will not only be able to turn like a tank, but also drive diagonally like a crab. According to Electrek, this change could be Tesla's reaction to what its competitors do. Since the introduction of Tesla’s novelty, the market for electric pickup trucks has significantly evolved. Currently, one electric pickup on the market can turn like a tank – the Rivian R1T, while GMC's Hummer EV can drive diagonally. Following the announcement of Tesla Cybertruck in 2019, the company announced three configurations of the pickup truck: the entry-level model with one motor, the one with two motors, and the one with three. Rumor has it that the company intends to abandon the single-motor version altogether. In this case, Tesla Cybertruck will be sold with two, three, and four motors. Musk has promised to provide an update on the pickup's roadmap on the next earnings call. The production of Tesla Cybertruck is expected to begin at the end of 2022, and its mass production is slated to start in 2023.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url of the news.

parameters.name: analyze
parameters.description: Whether to analyze the news (extract entities etc.)

get.description: Extract a news article from a website to a well structure JSON object. The API will return the title, text, URL, image, publish date, author, language, source country, and sentiment of the news article.

jokes.joke:
A retiring farmer in preparation for selling his land, needed to rid his farm of animals. So he went to every house in his town. 
To the houses where the man is the boss, he gave a horse. To the houses where the woman is the boss, a chicken was given. 
He got toward the end of the street and saw a couple outside gardening. "Who's the boss around here?" he asked. 
"I am." said the man. 
"I have a black horse and a brown horse," the farmer said, "which one would you like?" 
The man thought for a minute and said, "The black one." 
"No, no, no, get the brown one." the man's wife said. 
"Here's your chicken." said the farmer.

A blonde decides to try horseback riding, even though she has had no
lessons or prior experience. She mounts the horse unassisted and then
horse immediately springs into motion. It gallops along at a steady and
rhythmic pace, but the blonde begins to slip from the
saddle. In terror, she grabs for the horse's mane, but cannot seem to get
a firm grip.
She tries to throw her arms around the horse's neck, but she slides down
the side of the horse anyway. The horse gallops along, seemingly
impervious to its slipping rider. Finally, giving up her frail grip, she
leaps away from the horse to try and throw herself to safety.
Unfortunately, her foot has become entangled in the stirrup and she is now
at the mercy of the horse's pounding hooves as her head is battered
against the ground again and again. She is mere moments away from
unconsciousness when...
 ...the Wal-Mart manager runs out to shut the horse off.
Once Chuck Norris met a man on a horse that he did'nt like, now we know him as the headless horseman.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of words that must occur in the joke.

parameters.name: include-tags
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of tags the jokes should have.

parameters.name: exclude-tags

parameters.name: max-length

parameters.description: The number of jokes to skip, between 0 and 1000.

parameters.description: The number of jokes, between 1 and 10.

get.description: With over 50,000 jokes, you should find something for any occasion. There are 27 categories/tags to choose from, but you can also search for very specific words within jokes.

get.description: Search and filter thousands of recipes with natural language, e.g. pasta recipes without mushrooms but with truffles. You can filter by ingredients, diet, cuisine, meal type, macro and micro nutrition, intolerances, and much more.

steps.step: Bring 6 quarts of salted water to a rolling boil in a large pot. Season the flour with salt and pepper. Dredge the chicken in the seasoned flour.Shake off any excess.
Heat the oil in a large, heavy non-stick skillet over high heat. Brown the chicken on one side (about 3 minutes).
Add the garlic. Turn the chicken. Scatter the mushrooms over the chicken. Cook for 3 minutes, shaking the skillet to distribute the mushrooms.
Add the vinegar, broth, bay leaves, and thyme. Cover the skillet lightly. Cook, over medium heat for 10 minutes, turning the chicken once. Uncover.
Transfer the chicken to a warm plate. Cover with foil. Continue cooking the mushrooms for another 7 minutes. Cook the pasta, stirring frequently, in the boiling salted water until al dente.
Place on a warm serving plate. Arrange the chicken pieces over the pasta.
Remove the bay leaf from the sauce.
Pour the mushroom sauce over the chicken and pasta.

credits.text: Foodista.com – The Cooking Encyclopedia Everyone Can Edit

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the recipe to retrieve.

parameters.name: add-wine-pairing
parameters.description: Whether to pair a wine to the recipe.

get.description: Get detailed recipe information such as dietary properties, macro and micro nutrients, used ingredients and their amounts, and more.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the ingredients of the recipe.

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings the ingredients make. Nutrition is computed per serving.

parameters.name: reduce-oils
parameters.description: If there is oil in the ingredients, e.g. 3 tablespoons olive oil but they are used for frying, not all of the oil is consumed and therefore should not be added to the computed nutrition. In this case set reduce-oils to true.

get.description: Compute detailed nutritional information for a given recipe (list of ingredients). The API will return the nutritional information for each ingredient, as well as the total nutritional content for the entire recipe. Aside from macro and micro nutrients, the API also returns flavanoid information and food properties such as glycemic index, glycemic load, and inflammation score.

parameters.description: Whether the restaurants have to be open now.

parameters.name: page

get.description: Search through thousands of restaurants (in North America) by location, cuisine, budget, and more.

get.description: This API returns a random quote from a collection of quotes. The quotes are from famous people and are in English.

value.title: Purpose
value.author: Amos Russel Wells
value.poem:
Deeply and long the sap must flow
Ere the merest layer of elm can grow.

Many a wave's recurrent shock
Is needed to smooth the tiniest rock.

Thousands of leaves must fade and fall
To make the mold by the garden wall.

Thus, as the patient seasons roll,
Slowly is fashioned a human soul.

Purpose and failure and purpose still,
Steadily moved by a quiet will,—

Layer on layer in sturdy way,
Hardly seen the growth of a day,—

Times of failure and fear and fall,
But one strong tendency through it all,—

God and purpose and sun by sun
Reach the stars before they are done!
For I know the plans I have for you,” declares the Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future

parameters.name: min-lines
parameters.description: The minimum number of lines of the poem.

parameters.name: max-lines
parameters.description: The maximum number of lines of the poem.

get.description: Retrieve a random poem by many famous authors. You can filter poem's by length (number of lines).

get.summary: Image to Ascii Art by URL
get.description: Convert an image to ASCII art. You can pass the image URL as a query parameter. The API returns the ASCII art as plain text. This endpoint is using the GET method and an image URL as a query parameter.

value.title: Usher joined by Alicia Keys and will.i.am at Super Bowl half-time show
value.main_text:
R&B star Usher delivered a hit-heavy half-time show at Sunday's Super Bowl - with help from will.i.am, Alicia Keys, Ludacris... and a pair of roller skates.

A disclaimer shown before the performance jokingly warned viewers it may cause "singing, dancing, sweating, gyrating, and possible relationship issues". It would go on to deliver on all fronts. 

Dressed in all-white and surrounded by a swarm of energetic dancers, Usher emerged on the stage at the Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas and launched straight into one of his best-known songs, Caught Up.

It kicked off a dynamic performance which took advantage of the 45-year-old's dancing skills and sizeable back catalogue. 

Before his half-time show, Usher admitted it had been "a challenge to squeeze 30 years in to 13 minutes". But the singer did an admirable job of cramming in as many of his most recognisable songs as possible. 

The set featured acrobats and a brass band so large there were enough members to spell out "USHER" on the grounds of the stadium as he was performing.

The singer switched effortlessly between the two apexes of his music: club anthems and sex jams. 

Some songs ran for a full verse and a chorus, others for just a few seconds. A tiny snippet of Superstar appropriately saw him sing only the lyrics: "Spotlight / big stage / 50,000 fans screaming in a rage" - as if to hammer home the magnitude of his Super Bowl show. 

The dancers who surrounded him - many of whom had only travelled a short distance from his Vegas residency - wore colourful, even outlandish outfits, perfectly complementing his central performance and adding to the sense of spectacle.

Once Usher was a few songs deep and well into his groove, [...]

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url for which the content will be extracted.

get.summary: Extract Content from a Web Page
get.description: Extract the main content from a web page. This API is useful for extracting the main text, title, and images from a web page. It can be used to create a summary of the content of a web page, or to extract the main content of a web page to display it in a different format.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url for which the publish date should be extracted.

get.description: Extract the publish date of an article (news or blog). The API will return the publish date of the article if it can be found. The date returned is in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url with the article from which authors should be extracted.

get.description: Extracts the authors from a given URL. This API is useful for extracting the authors from a blog post or news article. The API will return a list of authors with their names and links to their profiles if available.

results.title: Penguin - Wikipedia
results.summary: Penguins are a group of aquatic flightless birds from the family Spheniscidae (/ s f ɪ ˈ n ɪ s ɪ d iː,-d aɪ /) of the order Sphenisciformes (/ s f ɪ ˈ n ɪ s ə f ɔːr m iː z /). They live almost exclusively in the Southern Hemisphere: only one species, the Galápagos penguin, is found north of the Equator.Highly adapted for life in the ocean water, penguins have countershaded dark ...

results.title: Penguin | Features, Habitat, & Facts | Britannica
results.summary: Learn about penguins, the flightless marine birds that live only in the Southern Hemisphere. Find out their general features, habitat, and facts, such as their distribution, diet, behavior, and conservation status. See images and videos of different species of penguins, such as the emperor, the fairy, and the Galapagos penguin.

results.title: Penguins, facts and photos - National Geographic
results.summary: Learn about the 18 different species of penguins, their adaptations, behavior, and threats. Find out how they live, breed, and feed in the Antarctic and subantarctic regions, and how they cope with the challenges of climate change and predators.

results.title: Official Pittsburgh Penguins Website | Pittsburgh Penguins - NHL.com
results.summary: The official website of the Pittsburgh Penguins, a professional ice hockey team in the National Hockey League. Find news, tickets, schedule, photos, video, scores, stats, community, and more about the team and its players.

results.title: Penguin | Species | WWF - World Wildlife Fund
results.summary: Learn about the 17 to 19 species of penguins that live in the Southern Hemisphere, from the tiny blue penguins of Australia and New Zealand to the majestic emperor penguins of Antarctica. Find out why they matter, what threats they face, and how you can help protect them.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of results to return in range [1,50]

get.description: Search the web for a given query. The API returns a list of results with the title, summary, and URL.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to be corrected.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language of the text, one of en, de, es, fr, or it.

get.description: The API corrects spelling mistakes in a given text. It returns the corrected text or the original text if nothing was corrected. This API supports text in the following languages: English (en), French (fr), German (de), Italian (it), and Spanish (es).

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text for which the language should be detected.

get.description: Detect the language of the given text. The API returns a list of languages and their confidence scores. The confidence score is a value between 0 and 1, where 1 means the language was detected with 100% confidence. The API supports text in 22 languages.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text for which the sentiment should be detected.

get.description: Detect the sentiment (positive or negative) of a given text. The entire document is scored and also each individual sentence.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the text to score.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to score for multiple metrics.

schema.example: A nice short story to be analyzed

get.description: Score the readability, skimmability, interestingness, and style of a text. The readability score is based on the average length of the sentences and the average length of the words in the text. The text is scored with multiple readability scores such as Flesch, Smog, ARI, LIX, Kincaid, Fog, and Coleman Liau. Additionally, information such as the estimated reading time in seconds is returned.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to score for readability.

schema.example: A rather complex text, hard to read, and highly convoluted using acronym TERMS.

get.description: Score the readability of a text. The readability score is based on the average length of the sentences and the average length of the words in the text. The text is score with multiple readability scores such as Flesch, Smog, ARI, LIX, Kincaid, Fog, and Coleman Liau.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text from which dates should be extracted.

schema.example: On 5th or April, 2035 there will be flying cars - 2023-02-12.

get.description: Extract dates from a given text. The API will return a list of dates with their positions in the text and the normalized form of the date. A large list of date formats is supported. For example, the text could contain dates in the form of "April 5th, 2035", "04/05/2035", or "05.04.2035". The normalized date is the date in the form of a timestamp (milliseconds since 1970).

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The (noun) word for which a list of synonyms should be returned.

get.description: Return synonyms of a word.

value.tagged_text: The/AT lazy/JJ dog/NN jumps/NNS over/UNDER the/AT quick/RB brown/JJ fox/NN

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to tag the part of speech.

schema.example: The lazy dog jumps over the quick brown fox.

get.description: Part of speech tagging is the process of marking up a word in a text as corresponding to a particular part of speech, based on both its definition and its context. This is a simple API that takes a text and returns the tagged text.

value.original: The laziest dogs are jumping over the quicker brown foxes
value.stemmed: The laziest dog are jump over the quicker brown fox

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to be stemmed.

schema.example: The laziest dogs are jumping over the quicker brown foxes.

get.description: The Text Stemming API is used to get the root form of a word. It is useful for searching and natural language processing.

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The (noun) word for which the singular form should be found.

get.description: Find the singular form of a word.

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: The (noun) word for which the plural form should be found.

get.description: Find the plural form of a word.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text from which entities should be extracted.

schema.example: Jim Carrey is an actor from Canada

get.description: Extract entities from a text. An entity is a word or a group of words that represent a concept. For example, the word "Canada" represents the concept of a country. The word "Jim Carrey" represents the concept of a person. The word "Tesla" represents the concept of a company. The API will return a list of entities found in the text. The entities are classified into different types such as person, location, organization, etc.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number of images to return in range [1,10]

get.description: Search through hundreds of thousands of royalty free images to match any topic you want. The images are returned in a list with the URL, width, and height of the image. Additionally, you can find the license type and link of the image.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url of the image to be rescaled.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The desired width of the rescaled image.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The desired height of the rescaled image.

parameters.name: crop
parameters.description: Whether the image should be cropped. If true, the returned image will have exactly the given width and height and some content might have been cropped from the left/right or top/bottom. If this parameter is false, the image will keep its ratio but will be resized to fill the given box. Some content might be outside the box though.

get.description: Rescale an image to a specific width and height. The image will be resized to fit the specified width and height while maintaining the original aspect ratio unless the crop parameter is set to true. The image will be returned in the same format as the original image.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url of the image for which the colors should be detected.

get.description: Detect the main color of an image. The API returns a list of colors and their hex codes. The API supports images in the following formats: JPEG, PNG, and GIF.

parameters.name: source-amount
parameters.description: The source amount.

parameters.name: source-unit
parameters.description: The source unit.

parameters.name: target-unit
parameters.description: The unit to which should be converted.

parameters.name: food-name
parameters.description: An optional food name. For converting foods the food is relevant as they have different densities.

get.description: Convert units from one to another. The API returns the amount and the unit of the target unit.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key for which the value is stored (max length 255 characters).

get.description: Read a value from the key-value store. The key-value store is a simple storage system that allows you to store and retrieve data using a key. The data is stored in the cloud and can be accessed from anywhere. You can use the key-value store to store any type of data, such as text or numbers. The key-value store is a great way to store data that you want to access from multiple devices or locations.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key for which the value is stored (max length 255 characters).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that is supposed to be stored (max length 10,000 characters).

get.description: Store a value in the key-value store. The key-value store is a simple storage system that allows you to store and retrieve data using a key. The data is stored in the cloud and can be accessed from anywhere. You can use the key-value store to store any type of data, such as text or numbers. The key-value store is a great way to store data that you want to access from multiple devices or locations.
